main event: On April 4, 1959, a B-47 aircraft encountered an unidentified aerial object while on a routine training mission near Kirtland AFB, New Mexico.
interesting points: The object was first sighted as a bright light approximately 30 miles northeast of Clovis, NM.,The altitude of the object was estimated to be between 20,000 and 30,000 feet.,The pilot described the object as being between 40 and 50 feet in diameter and oscillating as it moved.,The sighting lasted approximately 10 to 15 minutes before the object accelerated rapidly and disappeared.,The pilot confirmed it was not a meteor or weather balloon.
sighted object: a bright light initially appearing as an unidentified aerial object
witness description: Pilot of a B-47 aircraft from the 4950th Test Group
